column1: kwende pl. kwendî is the Primitive Quendian word for the Elves.
column2: Quendi and Eldar p. 360 The word was perhaps primarily used in the plural.

column1: Formed from the Sundocarmë KWENE (see kwene) with ostime of n > nd.
Since KWENE is probably expanded from KWE
column2: the most primitive stem having to do with articulate speech
column3: the term kwendî identifies the Elves as "speakers".: "Themselves they named the Quendi
column4: signifying those that speak with voices
column5: for as yet they had met no other living things that spoke or sang."

column1: Note that the final short -e was not lost in the later languages
column2: as it usually happens with other words.

column1: In the The Etymologies Quenya quendë "Elf" is derived from a stem KWEN(ED) simply defined as "Elf"
column2: and the primitive form is given as kwenedê.
